event: According to C.S. Lewis's 1955 memoir Surprised by Joy, C.S. Lewis was baptized in the Church of Ireland but fell away from C.S. Lewis's faith during adolescence.
Name: C.S. Lewis

event: In 2013, on the 50th anniversary of C.S. Lewis's , C.S. Lewis was honoured with a memorial in Poets' Corner in Westminster Abbey.
Name: C.S. Lewis

event: C.S. Lewis was born in Belfast in Ulster, Ireland (before partition), on 29 November 1898.
Name: C.S. Lewis

event: C.S. Lewis had an elder brother,  Warren Hamilton Lewis (known as "Warnie"). C.S. Lewis was baptized on 29 January 1899 by C.S. Lewis's maternal grandfather in St Mark's Church, Dundela.
Name: C.S. Lewis

event: In 1916, C.S. Lewis was awarded a scholarship at University College, Oxford.
Name: C.S. Lewis

event: On 15 April 1918, as the 1st Battalion of the regiment, then serving in France assaulted the village of Riez du Vinage in the midst of the German spring offensive, C.S. Lewis was wounded and two of C.S. Lewis's colleagues were killed by a British shell falling short of its targeta British shell falling short of its target's .
category2: First World War and Oxford University
Name: C.S. Lewis

event: C.S. Lewis was demobilized in December 1918 and soon restarted C.S. Lewis's studies.
category2: First World War and Oxford University
Name: C.S. Lewis

event: It seems most likely that C.S. Lewis was bound to Jack by the promise C.S. Lewis had given to another cadet, Edward Courtnay Francis "Paddy" Moore (1898–1918) and that C.S. Lewis's promise was reinforced by C.S. Lewis's love for his mother, Janie King Moore as C.S. Lewis's second mother.
Name: C.S. Lewis

event: C.S. Lewis became a member of the Church of England – somewhat to the disappointment of his Oxford colleague and friend J. R. R. Tolkien, whom he seems to have met for the first time on 11 May 1926 was a committed Anglican who upheld a largely orthodox Anglican theology, though in C.S. Lewis's apologetic writings, C.S. Lewis made an effort to avoid espousing any one denomination.
Name: C.S. Lewis

event: C.S. Lewis was named on the last list of honours by George VI in December 1951 as a Commander of the Order of the British Empire (CBE) but declined so as to avoid association with any political issues.
Name: C.S. Lewis

event: C.S. Lewis was then elected a Fellow of Magdalen College, Oxford, where he worked for nearly thirty years, from 1925 to 1954.
Name: C.S. Lewis

event: In 1954, C.S. Lewis was awarded the newly founded chair of Mediaeval and Renaissance Literature at Cambridge University, and was elected a fellow of Magdalen College, Oxford, where he worked for nearly thirty years, from 1925 to 1954.
Name: C.S. Lewis

event: C.S. Lewis's last academic work, The Discarded Image: An Introduction to Medieval and Renaissance Literature (1964), is a summary of the medieval world view, a reference to the "discarded image" of the cosmos.[0
Name: C.S. Lewis

event: In 2013, on the 50th anniversary of C.S. Lewis's death, C.S. Lewis joined some of Britain's greatest writers recognized at Poets' Corner, Westminster Abbey.
Name: C.S. Lewis
